verses.text: <a href="../2-Chronicles-14-1/" title="2 Chronicles 14:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1  "JESUS_END"So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead. In his days the land was quiet ten years.
2 "JESUS_END"And Asa did that which was good and right in the eyes of the LORD his God:
3 "JESUS_END"For he took away the altars of the strange gods, and the high places, and brake down the images, and cut down the groves:

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-4/" title="2 Chronicles 14:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4  "JESUS_END"And commanded Judah to seek the LORD God of their fathers, and to do the law and the commandment.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-5/" title="2 Chronicles 14:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5  "JESUS_END"Also he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the images: and the kingdom was quiet before him.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-6/" title="2 Chronicles 14:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6  "JESUS_END"And he built fenced cities in Judah: for the land had rest, and he had no war in those years; because the LORD had given him rest.

7 "JESUS_END"Therefore he said unto Judah, Let us build these cities, and make about them walls, and towers, gates, and bars, while the land is yet before us; because we have sought the LORD our God, we have sought him, and he hath given us rest on every side. So they built and prospered.

8 "JESUS_END"And Asa had an army of men that bare targets and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bare shields and drew bows, two hundred and fourscore thousand: all these were mighty men of valour.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-9/" title="2 Chronicles 14:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9  "JESUS_END"And there came out against them Zerah the Ethiopian with an host of a thousand thousand, and three hundred chariots; and came unto Mareshah.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-10/" title="2 Chronicles 14:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10  "JESUS_END"Then Asa went out against him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.

11 "JESUS_END"And Asa cried unto the LORD his God, and said, LORD, it is nothing with thee to help, whether with many, or with them that have no power: help us, O LORD our God; for we rest on thee, and in thy name we go against this multitude. O LORD, thou art our God; let not man prevail against thee.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-12/" title="2 Chronicles 14:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12  "JESUS_END"So the LORD smote the Ethiopians before Asa, and before Judah; and the Ethiopians fled.

13 "JESUS_END"And Asa and the people that were with him pursued them unto Gerar: and the Ethiopians were overthrown, that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before the LORD, and before his host; and they carried away very much spoil.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-14/" title="2 Chronicles 14:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14  "JESUS_END"And they smote all the cities round about Gerar; for the fear of the LORD came upon them: and they spoiled all the cities; for there was exceeding much spoil in them.

<a href="../2-Chronicles-14-15/" title="2 Chronicles 14:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15  "JESUS_END"They smote also the tents of cattle, and carried away sheep and camels in abundance, and returned to Jerusalem.
